To complete a payment in Kastana POS:

1. Ensure the order has items
2. Click the "Pay" button in the order panel
3. Select payment method (Cash, Visa, Mastercard, Wallet, etc.)
4. If paying with cash:
   â€¢ Enter the amount received
   â€¢ System will calculate change automatically
5. Click "Confirm Payment"
6. Receipt will print automatically (if printer connected)

Note: You can split payment across multiple methods (e.g., part cash, part card)

content.en:
To hold an order:

1. While working on an order, click "Hold" button
2. Order will be saved with all items and notes
3. You can start a new order

To resume a held order:

1. Click "Held Orders" in the top bar
2. Select the order to resume
3. Click "Resume"
4. Order will load and you can continue working on it

Note: Held orders remain saved until shift closes or they are resumed

2. Click order options (â‹®)

â€¢ Notes from both orders are preserved

content.en:
Gross:
â€¢ Total amount before any discounts or refunds
â€¢ Includes tax and service charges
â€¢ Example: Sum of item prices = 100 JOD

Net:
â€¢ Actual amount after discounts and refunds
â€¢ Net = Gross - Discounts - Refunds
â€¢ Example: 100 - 10 (discount) - 5 (refund) = 85 JOD

In Reports:
â€¢ "Gross Sales" = Amount before discounts
â€¢ "Net Sales" = Final collected amount
â€¢ "Profit Margin" is calculated on net

Note: Tax is usually calculated on net, not gross

content.en:
Refunds in Kastana POS:

Types of Refunds:
1. Full Refund: Return entire order value
2. Partial Refund: Return value of specific items

When to use refunds:
â€¢ Customer unsatisfied with item
â€¢ Order mistake after payment
â€¢ Partial cancellation after payment complete

Difference between Void and Refund:
â€¢ Void: Before payment - doesn't affect reports
â€¢ Refund: After payment - recorded in reports

In Reports:
â€¢ Refunds appear in Z Report
â€¢ Deducted from net sales
â€¢ Reason for each refund is saved for review

Note: Refunds typically require special permissions
